content.raw:
It's true that the `no-gpu` job had fewer test failures, but the `INTEGRATION_speed` test did have this assertion:
~~~
235: INTEGRATION_speed:
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher; 
typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transport::Publisher*]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
235:  87/110 Test #235: INTEGRATION_speed .....................................***Exception: Other 99.25 sec
~~~
content.html:
It's true that the no-gpu job had fewer test failures, but the INTEGRATION_speed test did have this assertion:

235: INTEGRATION_speed:
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher; 
typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transport::Publisher*]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
235:  87/110 Test #235: INTEGRATION_speed .....................................***Exception: Other 99.25 sec

content.raw: That's what happens when filenames are limited to 8 characters
content.html: That's what happens when filenames are limited to 8 characters

content.raw: iphlpapi is the [IP helper API](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms923578.aspx) (I looked it up). So this is a normal target link libraries call, if you know what the library is.
content.html: iphlpapi is the IP helper API (I looked it up). So this is a normal target link libraries call, if you know what the library is.

content.raw: I reverted this change. I'll investigate more once all the window pull requests get merged in.
content.html: I reverted this change. I'll investigate more once all the window pull requests get merged in.

content.raw: Interesting. The [no-gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/189/testReport/) had very different results.
content.html: Interesting. The no-gpu had very different results.

content.raw:
Now that I wrote that, I noticed [tons of test failures](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/134/) with the following console message:
~~~
97: UNIT_Visual_TEST:
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: 
typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const
[with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transport::Publisher*]:
Assertion `px != 0' failed.
~~~
So there probably is something wrong. I'll try to get a backtrace tomorrow.
content.html:
Now that I wrote that, I noticed tons of test failures with the following console message:

97: UNIT_Visual_TEST:
/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:653: 
typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const
[with T = gazebo::transport::Publisher; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transport::Publisher*]:
Assertion `px != 0' failed.

So there probably is something wrong. I'll try to get a backtrace tomorrow.

content.raw: At first it looked unsafe to me, but then I noticed the `publisherDeleteMutex` is locked for the whole function, which will protect against deleted publishers. The `publisherMutex` appears to be used only here, in [Fini](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9a9508c1afd297907cdf3a2952b2a5a10c6ec042/gazebo/transport/Node.cc#cl-68), and in [Advertise](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/9a9508c1afd297907cdf3a2952b2a5a10c6ec042/gazebo/transport/Node.hh?at=win_transport#cl-161) when publishers are added to the array. So this makes sense to me.
content.html: At first it looked unsafe to me, but then I noticed the publisherDeleteMutex is locked for the whole function, which will protect against deleted publishers. The publisherMutex appears to be used only here, in Fini, and in Advertise when publishers are added to the array. So this makes sense to me.

content.raw: Got it. It's identical to the function in [`ignition-transport::NetUtils`](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-transport/src/89b09d95a1855e753d7a7e11eaf36466b783ac9e/src/NetUtils.cc?at=default#cl-171), so I'm going to assume it's stable without running it on Windows :)
content.html: Got it. It's identical to the function in ignition-transport::NetUtils, so I'm going to assume it's stable without running it on Windows :)

content.raw: Yes. On a very slow machine, I saw a repeatable deadlock.
content.html: Yes. On a very slow machine, I saw a repeatable deadlock.

content.raw: Or ROS, I didn't pull this in.
content.html: Or ROS, I didn't pull this in.

content.raw: Any reason for adding this scope for the mutex? Did you run into deadlock on Windows or is this just a general improvement?
content.html: Any reason for adding this scope for the mutex? Did you run into deadlock on Windows or is this just a general improvement?
